section.title: Log in to the dashboard
section.para: The dashboard is available from any internet connected device with a reasonbly modern browser.

step.para: Open a Web browser. Make sure that JavaScript and cookies are enabled.

note.para: To use the Virtual Network Computing (VNC) client for the dashboard, your browser must support HTML5 Canvas and HTML5 WebSockets. The VNC client is based on noVNC. For details, see noVNC: HTML5 VNC Client. For a list of supported browsers, see Browser support.

step.para: On the Log In page, enter your regular Naturalis user name and password, and click Sign In.
If you are logged in as an administrator, the main screen shows the Project tab and Admin tab.

section.para: The top-level row shows your user name. You can also access Settings or sign out of the dashboard.
The visible tabs and functions in the dashboard depend on the access permissions, or roles, of the user you are logged in as.
If you are logged in as an end user, the main screen just shows the Project tab.

section.title: OpenStack dashboard—Project tab
section.para: Resources in OpenStack are always associated to a project. As a user you'll be member of at least one project, and possibly more. You find the resources associated with a project under the project tab.

note.title: Need access to an existing project?
note.para: Please ask the head of your department to send a request to ICT Support for access to a project and it's associated resources.

section.para: Select a project from the CURRENT PROJECT drop-down list on the left side to view and manage resources in that project.
The Project tab displays the details of the selected project.

listitem.para: View reports about resource usage within the project.
View, launch, create a snapshot from, stop, pause, or reboot instances, or connect to them through VNC.
Instances are the OpenStack term for cloud based virtual machines
View, create, edit, and delete volumes.
External disk-based data storage that can be mounted to your instance. Often used to separate data from the software on and configuration of instances.

View images, instance snapshots, and volume snapshots created project users, plus any images that are publicly available. Create, edit, and delete images, and launch instances from images and snapshots.

Images contain a specific operating system (OS) that you use to create or rebuild an instance. OpenStack provides pre-built images. You can also create custom images, or snapshots, from servers that you have launched. Custom images can be used for data backups or as "gold" images for additional servers.
Use the following tabs to complete these tasks:

formalpara.title: Security Groups tab
formalpara.para:
View, create, edit, and delete security groups and security group rules.
Security groups are used to filter network traffic to and from instances. If you need to access an instance over SSH (normally port 22) you need to associate a security group that instance that allows that.

formalpara.title: Keypairs tab
formalpara.para:
View, create, edit, and import keypairs, and delete keypairs.
Keys are a means of identifying yourself to a server. Keypairs By automatically injecting a public key to an instance OpenStack allows you to login over SSH with your private key.

formalpara.title: Floating IPs tab
formalpara.para:
Allocate an IP address to or release it from an instance.
Floating IP addresses have to be associated with an instance in order to make the instance accessible from other parts of the network. Without a floating IP address an instance can only 'see' the private network with which it is associated within the project

formalpara.title: API Access tab
formalpara.para:
View API endpoints.
API endpoints are the servers on which the service runs with which any API client communicates.

listitem.para: Create and manage public and private networks.
Create and manage subnets.
View the network topology.
Create and manage object storage.
Use REST API to orchestrate multiple composite cloud applications

section.title: OpenStack dashboard—Admin tab
section.para: Enables administrative users to view usage and manage instances, volumes, flavors, images, projects, users, services, and quotas.
Access the following categories to complete these tasks:

listitem.para: View basic reports.
Use the following tabs to view the following usages:

formalpara.title: Global Disk Usage tab
formalpara.para: View the global disk usage for all tenants as an average over the last 30 days.

formalpara.title: Global Network Traffic Usage tab
formalpara.para: View the global network usage for all tenants as an average over the last 30 days.

formalpara.title: Global Object Storage Usage tab
formalpara.para: View the global object storage usage for all tenants as an average over the last 30 days.

formalpara.title: Global Network Usage tab
formalpara.para: View the global network usage for all tenants as an average over the last 30 days.

formalpara.title: Stats tab
formalpara.para: View the statistics of all resources.

listitem.para: View the hypervisor summary.

View, pause, resume, suspend, migrate, soft or hard reboot, and delete running instances that belong to users of some, but not all, projects. Also, view the log for an instance or access an instance through VNC.
View, create, edit, and delete volumes and volume types.
View, create, edit, view extra specs for, and delete flavors. A flavor is size for an instance.
View, create, edit properties for, and delete custom images.
View, create, edit properties for, and delete networks.
View, create, edit properties for, and delete routers.
View default quota values. Quotas are hard-coded in OpenStack Compute and define the maximum allowable size and number of resources.
Use the following tabs to view the service info:

formalpara.title: Services tab
formalpara.para: View a list of the services.

formalpara.title: Compute Services tab
formalpara.para: View a list of all Compute services.

listitem.para: View domains.
View, create, assign users to, remove users from, and delete projects.
View, create, enable, disable, and delete users.
View, create, enable, disable, and delete groups.
View, create, enable, disable, and delete roles.
